image.altText: Police officers in an Adelaide suburban street.

props.synopsis: One man has died and police expect to charge another with murder after an alleged serious assault and altercation in the street in Adelaide's north on Thursday night.

title.children: Police expect to charge a man with murder after altercation in Parafield Gardens

image.altText: Police at the scene of a crash at Port Lincoln.

props.synopsis: The 23-month-old girl was struck by the car along the seaside city's main shopping strip late on Thursday afternoon, and has been taken to Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital.

title.children: Toddler taken to hospital in critical condition after being hit by car at Port Lincoln

image.altText: An Adelaide ambulance.

props.synopsis: A senior Royal Adelaide Hospital doctor has been prevented from giving evidence about ambulance ramping to an inquest investigating the deaths of three patients, with the inquiry hearing SA Health had "refused" to allow her to speak on the subject.

title.children: Doctor blocked from giving ambulance ramping evidence after SA Health 'refused', inquest told

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman's hands clasped on a lap

props.synopsis: As a frontline domestic violence service demands "urgent" funding in response to a record spike in calls for help, a survivor speaks out in support of new measures to outlaw coercive control in SA.

title.children: Survivor who was 'scared to say anything' speaks out as SA moves to criminalise coercive control

image.altText: Port Adelaide's Dan Houston makes a handpass

props.synopsis: Dan Houston has shut down persistent links with a move back to his home state of Victoria, saying he will remain at Port Adelaide in 2025.

title.children: 'I absolutely love the footy club': Dan Houston set to remain at Port Adelaide despite rampant trade rumours

image.altText: Two King George whiting in hands of a man.

props.synopsis: A review of catch limits for four popular fish species is underway in South Australia as the peak body for recreational anglers accuses the commercial sector of overfishing.

title.children: Recreational anglers say they're copping the blame for SA's dwindling fish numbers

image.altText: A large sign in the shape of a boomerang with Yalata written on it

props.synopsis: The South Australian coroner says he can not conclude whether a young Indigenous mother's death, at the hands of her partner, could have been prevented if authorities intervened. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the name of a person who has died.

title.children: Coroner's findings into DV murder of young Indigenous mother inconclusive

image.altText: School sign in front of school

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Minister says there is "no space" for what he calls "totally unacceptable" behaviour alleged to have occurred at one of Adelaide's most prestigious schools.

title.children: Alleged sexist student behaviour at top school denounced as 'totally unacceptable'

image.altText: person in chicken outfit does jump while riding a quad bike

props.synopsis: The Main Arena has been the heart of the show for nearly 100 years, and in that time it's seen just about everything, including human cannonballs and a dozen Volkswagen Beetles in a "very slow" precision driving act.

title.children: It's weird, it's loud and the Royal Adelaide Show has been doing it for almost a century

image.altText: Mattijs Bellers of Netherlands in action against Frank Ponder of Australia

props.synopsis: The Rollers — two-time Paralympic gold medallists — meet the Netherlands in their first game in the men's wheelchair basketball. Follow live.

title.children: Rollers aiming to end day one on a high after para-swimmers begin medal haul

image.altText: large cliffs of the Great Australian Bight, blue ocean sunny day

props.synopsis: A Liberal senator is leading a renewed push to permanently protect the Great Australian Bight from oil and gas exploration by having it listed as a World Heritage Site.

title.children: Bight World Heritage bid seeks to ban oil drilling as Liberal senator joins fight

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities provide big benefits to kids – but how much is too much?

image.altText: A man in a green hat leaning against a fuel pump

props.synopsis: Regional general store owners say they love their jobs, but with rising pressures there are concerns whether there'll be anyone willing to take on the challenge when they sell up.

title.children: The corner store is 'a lifestyle, not a job' for these proprietors who fear being left behind

image.altText: Carp fishing

props.synopsis: Australian researchers and chef Duncan Welgemoed are advocating for the pest species to be used to feed into health and beauty products in a multi-billion-dollar industry.

title.children: Why a top chef wants you to put carp collagen on your face

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: The prime minister overturns a decision earlier this week to omit a new question on sexuality being added to the national census.

title.children: Breaking: Albanese backs down on decision to exclude LGBT question from next census

image.altText: A roll of barbed wire atop a prison wall at night.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy has taken his own life inside WA's controversial Banksia Hill, becoming the second child to die in youth detention in the state in less than a year.

title.children: Teenage boy dies by suicide inside Banksia Hill, second child to die in WA youth detention in less than a year

image.altText: Dr Javeria Jalal looking at the camera. She is sitting in her home with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Nine maths teachers, seven women and two men, are set to lose their jobs at the University of Melbourne. Three women are taking the case to the state human rights commission alleging gender discrimination.

title.children: A university teacher returned to work four weeks after an emergency c-section. Now she's facing the axe from her employer

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz hold up their hands on stage at a campaign rally

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris and her running mate Tim Walz sit down for their first interview with CNN since President Joe Biden withdrew from his White House bid. Follow live.

title.children: 'Next question, please': Harris dismisses Trump's racial attacks in first major interview of candidacy

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: A baby boy burned after coffee was poured on him in a random attack at a Brisbane park will have surgery today to help determine the extent of his injuries.

title.children: Baby boy burned in hot coffee attack to undergo surgery as search for suspect continues

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: The findings published by the New South Wales Independent Casino Commission found the group failed to address a culture of unethical conduct and criminal infiltration within the struggling business.

title.children: Future of Sydney's Star Casino uncertain after report finds toxic culture not addressed

image.altText: An artist's impression of the proposed development at Port Douglas.

props.synopsis: When Australian investors tipped millions into a large investment fund, they probably didn't expect it would go towards an event with boxer Floyd Mayweather or a penthouse for the wife of a property developer whose fortunes are tied to the fund. But that's exactly what the corporate watchdog has alleged.

title.children: Corporate watchdog claims investment money may have been used to buy $4.5m penthouse for developer's wife

image.altText: Crane on Melbourne construction site at sunrise

props.synopsis: The Victorian government probe was commissioned after allegations surfaced of bullying and intimidation within the construction branch of the embattled union.

title.children: Construction workers scared to blow whistle due to 'fear of reprisal', government investigation finds

image.altText: NAB chief executive Andrew Irvine speaks into a microphone at a parliamentary committee.

props.synopsis: NAB and ANZ will face a parliamentary hearing today after Commonwealth Bank and Westpac appeared yesterday. Australia's share market is poised to open higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: NAB describes scams as 'plague of our times' at parliamentary hearing

image.altText: Sheets of metal are wrapped round a powerline in the middle of several houses

props.synopsis: The storm has caused the death of three people as it moves towards central Japan including the capital Tokyo.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan forces millions to evacuate as damage intensifies

image.altText: A dentist attends to a patient at an RFDS dental clinic

props.synopsis: Dental healthcare gets left on the back burner for Australians who can't afford day-to-day costs, as patients who rely on public dental care face lengthy wait times.

title.children: Taking loans to fix teeth, choosing to make rent over dentist fees. Australians reveal true toll of dental care neglect

image.altText: A small boy with tears in his eyes is held by his mother as a doctor works at a desk behind him

props.synopsis: The Israeli military and Palestinian militant group have agreed to pause fighting over three separate periods to allow WHO staff to vaccinate children for polio across the besieged enclave.

title.children: Israel and Hamas agree to three-day pauses in hostilities for Gaza polio campaign

image.altText: Singer Robbie Williams dressed in all one colour raises his arms in the air as he performs at the AFL Grand Final at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Supreme Court found grand prix organisers misled a music touring company about messages received from then-chief health officer Brett Sutton during the pandemic.

title.children: Australian Grand Prix ordered to pay $2.8m to Robbie Williams promoter over concert cancelled by COVID

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call to a property in Wieambilla. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: Damaged ship with mast down at port with a shipping container in the background

props.synopsis: Two people are injured following a collision between a large container ship and a training vessel at a Perth port.

title.children: Two people injured as container ship collides with training vessel at Perth port

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: ACT Policing has issued a warning to the community after two people died yesterday from suspected drug overdoses.

title.children: Public health warning issued after two people die from suspected drug overdoses in Canberra

image.altText: A police vehcile parked outside a house surrounded by a trees.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a man with two counts of murder and will allege he failed to contact emergency services after two people were found unresponsive on Thursday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after two people found dead at Brisbane house

image.altText: A man's hands holding a mobile phone trying to onto myGov.

props.synopsis: Scammers are taking advantage of tax time with deceptive emails designed to steal your personal information.

title.children: Have you received an email from myGov recently? You might need to look closer

image.altText: Bee on flower

props.synopsis: After four consecutive dry winters, beekeepers in Western Australia are warning of diminished hives and biodiversity loss as fewer flowers bloom and pollen dries up.

title.children: Honey supply under threat in Australia as native flowers fail to bloom

image.altText: A man in suit.

props.synopsis: Kiingi Tuheitia, New Zealand's Maori king, dies at the age of 69 just days after the celebration of his 18th year on the throne.

title.children: 'A moment of great sadness': Maori King Tuheitia dies at 69 after heart surgery

image.altText: US Army official holds wreath alongside Donald Trump and elderly man

props.synopsis: The US Army confirmed a service member was "abruptly pushed aside" by a member of Trump's team after she tried to stop the Republican camp from filming in Section 60.

title.children: Why has Donald Trump's visit to Arlington National Cemetery caused controversy?
